xxl.core.io

Class Block

  • java.lang.Object
    • xxl.core.io.Block
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Cloneable, SizeAware

    public class Block
extends Object
implements Cloneable, SizeAware
    This class provides a block of serialized data. A block wraps a byte array that stores the serialized data and adds methods for reading and writing single bytes or the whole block. The block can additionally be released when its serialized data is not longer needed.

    Example usage (1). 

         // create a new block of five bytes

     Block block = new Block(5);

     // catch IOExceptions

     try {

         // open a data output stream on the block

         DataOutputStream output = block.dataOutputStream();

         // write the bytes 0 to 4 to the data output stream

         for (int i = 0; i < 5; i++)
             output.write(i);

         // invert every bit of the block

         for (int i = 0; i < block.size; i++)
             block.set(i, (byte)block.get(i));

         // open a data input stream on the block

         DataInputStream input = block.dataInputStream();

         // print the five bytes contained by the block

         while (input.available()>0)
             System.out.println(input.read());

     }
     catch (IOException ioe) {
         System.out.println("An I/O error occured.");
     }

     // release the block

     block.release();
    See Also:
    DataInputStream, DataOutputStream, InputStream, IOException, OutputStream

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      byte[] array
      The byte array stores the serialized data of the block.
      static Function GET_REAL_LENGTH
      Gets the length from the beginning of a Block.
      int offset
      The int value offset determines the index of the byte array where this block starts.
      protected boolean released
      The flag released signals whether this block is released or not.
      static Function SET_REAL_LENGTH
      Writes the length to the beginning of a Block using little endian byte ordering (4 bytes).
      int size
      The int value size determines the number of bytes this block is able to store.

    • Field Detail

      • SET_REAL_LENGTH

        public static Function SET_REAL_LENGTH
        Writes the length to the beginning of a Block using little endian byte ordering (4 bytes). The function returns the block.

      • GET_REAL_LENGTH

        public static Function GET_REAL_LENGTH
        Gets the length from the beginning of a Block. Not every Block contains this information!

      • array

        public byte[] array
        The byte array stores the serialized data of the block. The block starts at index offset of the array and contains size bytes.

      • offset

        public int offset
        The int value offset determines the index of the byte array where this block starts. Bytes at indices that are less than offset did not belong to this block.

      • size

        public int size
        The int value size determines the number of bytes this block is able to store.

      • released

        protected boolean released
        The flag released signals whether this block is released or not. It is not possible to access a released block in order to read or write bytes.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Block

        public Block(byte[] array,
             int offset,
             int size)
      throws IllegalArgumentException
        Constructs a new Block that wraps the specified array. The block starts at the index of the byte array specified by offset and contain size bytes.
        Parameters:
        array - the byte array that contains the serialized data of the block.
        offset - the index of the byte array where the block starts.
        size - the number of bytes the block contains.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - when the byte array is not able to store this block. In other words, an exception is thrown when (array.length<offset+size).

      • Block

        public Block(byte[] array)
        Constructs a new Block that wraps the specified array. The whole byte array is used for storing the block. This constructor is equivalent to the call of Block(array, 0, array.length).
        Parameters:
        array - the byte array that contains the serialized data of the block.

      • Block

        public Block(int blockSize)
        Constructs a new Block that contains a number of bytes specified by blockSize. The block creates a new byte array in order to store its serialized data. This constructor is equivalent to the call of Block(new byte[blockSize], 0, blockSize).
        Parameters:
        blockSize - the number of bytes the block contains.

    • Method Detail

      • release

        public void release()
             throws IllegalStateException
        Signals that the serialized data of this block is no longer needed and releses the block. After releasing a block, it is not possible to access it in order to read or write bytes.
        Note that this method is not idempotent. A call of this method on a released block will cause an IllegalStateException.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if this block is already released.

      • set

        public byte set(int index,
                byte b)
         throws IllegalStateException,
                IndexOutOfBoundsException
        Replaces the byte at the specified index of this block with the specified byte and returns the set byte. When this block is released or the specified index is out of its bounds, an exception will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        index - the index of the byte that should be set.
        b - the new value of the byte at index index.
        Returns:
        the set byte.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if this block is already released.
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the specified index is out of this block's bounds. In other words, an exception is thrown when (index<0 || index>=size).

      • get

        public byte get(int index)
         throws IllegalStateException,
                IndexOutOfBoundsException
        Returns the byte at the specified index of this block. When this block is released or the specified index is out of its bounds, an exception will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        index - position which is retrieved.
        Returns:
        the byte at the specified index.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if this block is already released.
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the specified index is out of this block's bounds. In other words, an exception is thrown when (index<0 || index>=size).

      • writeInteger

        public void writeInteger(int position,
                         int value)
        Writes an integer inside the Block to a specified position (little endian).
        Parameters:
        position - write offset
        value - value to be written

      • readInteger

        public int readInteger(int position)
        Reads an integer from a specified position inside the Block (little endian).
        Parameters:
        position - read offset
        Returns:
        the integer value

        public void writeLong(int position,
                      long value)
        Writes a long inside the Block to a specified position (little endian).
        Parameters:
        position - write offset
        value - value to be written

      • readLong

        public long readLong(int position)
        Reads a long from a specified position inside the Block (little endian).
        Parameters:
        position - read offset
        Returns:
        the long value

      • outputStream

        public OutputStream outputStream(int base,
                                 int end)
        Returns a new output stream that depends on this block. The output stream starts writing at index base (inclusive) and stops at index end (exclusive) of this block. When writing more than (end-base) bytes, the write method of the output stream will cause an IOException.
        Parameters:
        base - the index of this block where the output stream starts writing (inclusive).
        end - the index of this block where the output stream stops writing (exclusive).
        Returns:
        a new output stream, that depends on this block.

      • outputStream

        public OutputStream outputStream(int base)
        Returns a new output stream that depends on this block. The output stream starts writing at index base (inclusive) and stops at the end of this block. When writing more than (size-base) bytes, the write method of the output stream will cause an IOException.
        Parameters:
        base - the index of this block where the output stream starts writing (inclusive).
        Returns:
        a new output stream, that depends on this block.

      • outputStream

        public OutputStream outputStream()
        Returns a new output stream that depends on this block. The output stream writes the whole block. When writing more than size bytes, the write method of the output stream will cause an IOException.
        Returns:
        a new output stream, that depends on this block.

      • dataOutputStream

        public DataOutputStream dataOutputStream(int base,
                                         int end)
        Returns a new data output stream that depends on this block. The data output stream wraps an output stream created by calling outputStream(base, end). The underlying output stream starts writing at index base (inclusive) and stops at index end (exclusive) of this block. When writing more than (end-base) bytes, the write method of the underlying output stream will cause an IOException.
        Parameters:
        base - the index of this block where the data output stream starts writing (inclusive).
        end - the index of this block where the data output stream stops writing (exclusive).
        Returns:
        a new data output stream, that depends on this block.

      • dataOutputStream

        public DataOutputStream dataOutputStream(int base)
        Returns a new data output stream that depends on this block. The data output stream wraps an output stream created by calling outputStream(base). The underlying output stream starts writing at index base (inclusive) and stops at the end of this block. When writing more than (size-base) bytes, the write method of the underlying output stream will cause an IOException.
        Parameters:
        base - the index of this block where the data output stream starts writing (inclusive).
        Returns:
        a new data output stream, that depends on this block.

      • dataOutputStream

        public DataOutputStream dataOutputStream()
        Returns a new data output stream that depends on this block. The data output stream wraps an output stream created by calling outputStream(). The underlying output stream writes the whole block. When writing more than size bytes, the write method of the underlying output stream will cause an IOException.
        Returns:
        a new data output stream, that depends on this block.

      • inputStream

        public InputStream inputStream(int base,
                               int end)
        Returns a new input stream that depends on this block. The input stream starts reading at index base (inclusive) and stops at index end (exclusive) of this block. When reading more than (end-base) bytes, the read method of the input stream will return -1.
        Parameters:
        base - the index of this block where the input stream starts reading (inclusive).
        end - the index of this block where the input stream stops reading (exclusive).
        Returns:
        a new input stream, that depends on this block.

        Parameters:
        base - the index of this block where the input stream starts reading (inclusive).
        Returns:
        a new input stream, that depends on this block.

      • inputStream

        public InputStream inputStream()
        Returns a new input stream that depends on this block. The input stream reads the whole block. When reading more than size bytes, the read method of the input stream will return -1.
        Returns:
        a new input stream, that depends on this block.

      • dataInputStream

        public DataInputStream dataInputStream(int base,
                                       int end)
        Returns a new data input stream that depends on this block. The data input stream wraps an input stream created by calling inputStream(base, end). The underlying input stream starts reading at index base (inclusive) and stops at index end (exclusive) of this block. When reading more than (end-base) bytes, the read method of the underlying input stream will return -1.
        Parameters:
        base - the index of this block where the data input stream starts reading (inclusive).
        end - the index of this block where the data input stream stops reading (exclusive).
        Returns:
        a new data input stream, that depends on this block.

      • dataInputStream

        public DataInputStream dataInputStream(int base)
        Returns a new data input stream that depends on this block. The data input stream wraps an input stream created by calling inputStream(base). The underlying input stream starts reading at index base (inclusive) and stops at the end of this block. When reading more than (size-base) bytes, the read method of the underlying input stream will return -1.
        Parameters:
        base - the index of this block where the data input stream starts reading (inclusive).
        Returns:
        a new data input stream, that depends on this block.

      • dataInputStream

        public DataInputStream dataInputStream()
        Returns a new data input stream that depends on this block. The data input stream wraps an input stream created by calling inputStream(). The underlying input stream reads the whole block. When reading more than size bytes, the read method of the underlying input stream will return -1.
        Returns:
        a new data input stream, that depends on this block.

      • compress

        public Block compress()
        Compresses (zips) the current Block and returns the compressed Block. This function works with a ByteArrayOutputStream, because the size of the compressed array cannot be evaluated before the ZipOutputStream has run.
        Returns:
        the compressed Block.

      • decompress

        public Block decompress()
        Uncompresses (unzips) the current Block and returns the original Block. This function works with a ByteArrayOutputStream, because the size of the decompressed array cannot be evaluated before the ZipInputStream has finished its work.
        Returns:
        the decompressed Block.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(Object object)
        Indicates whether some other Record is "equal to" this one. Implementation: Get the InputStream of each Record and read single bytes until the bytes are not equal.
        Overrides:
        equals in class Object
        Parameters:
        object - - the reference object with which to compare.
        Returns:
        true if this Block is the same as the object argument, false otherwise.

      • hashCode

        public int hashCode()
        Returns a hash code for the Block. The implementation is efficient and produces different hashCodes for most of the blocks.
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class Object
        See Also:
        Object.hashCode()

        public Object clone()
             throws CloneNotSupportedException
        Clones the Block object.
        Overrides:
        clone in class Object
        Returns:
        the (deeply) cloned object.
        Throws:
        CloneNotSupportedException - Never should do this.

      • getMemSize

        public int getMemSize()
        Returns the converted size of the node in bytes.
        Specified by:
        getMemSize in interface SizeAware
        Returns:
        The size in bytes.

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Outputs the bytes of a block to a String. The String contains the byte values as well as the character representation.
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
        Returns:
        the String
